result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin Mark Sommerfeld

records.addlTxt: Signed by EFV on 9/9/22. Extraditable statewide,  Defendant failed to provide verification of treatment and failed to provide updated address as ordered. ec: Attys, c: SCSO. kma
Defendant failed to provide verification of treatment and failed to provide updated address as ordered.

9:02 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Defendant Justin Mark Sommerfeld not in court.  Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for Justin Mark Sommerfeld.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Hallway called. Set for STC. Court reviews file. DE was authorized to appear by Zoom for today's hearing, but is not on Zoom. DE is in absconder status with JSC. RUMS rec'd for DE. Atty Schmidt states DE is in treatment and will be for some time, but hasn't rec'd verification as of yet, but will work to receive from DE. ADA Smestad requests warrant, but won't object to quashing it if verification is rec'd. Atty Schmidt requests stayed warrant. Court issues warrant and STAYS until 9/1/22 to allow for verification from treatment and current address of Defendant to be filed. Shelby of JSC asks for clarification regarding testing at JSC while DE is in treatment. Court will not remove testing at JSC until It receives more specific information regarding testing at the treatment facility. Adjourned at 9:06 AM.  gll
Filed by ADA Smestad. km
DE's copy of NOH for 8/25 STC. RTS/Temporarily Away. kma
of Absconder Status. Filed by JSC. SEALED. km        to rg
Pretrial Bond Report. Filed by JSC. SEALED. km      to rg
Status conference on August 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.   ***New notice mailed to Defendant 6/27/22, as Defendant was no longer in custody to receive.****
Per EFV during INIT. arc
Status conference on August 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

**AMENDED**

- Baseline test, Prior to release.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- Not to possess firearms or weapons. 

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing [or/and] random ETG testing at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges. I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, B. Stinski.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:49 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Holly Elkin Rockow with Intern Connor Smith, DF ATTY: Donna Burger with Intern Kaitlyn Dippolito, DF: Justin Mark Sommerfeld appeared from jail. Court reviews case. Court notes Atty Schmidt was appointed and bond is already set. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant qualifies for PD. Bond arguments. Enters NG plea. Reserve on pre-plea rights. Intern Dippolito request next hearing to be scheduled as soon as possible. Sidebar. Court amends bond. Court judicially transfers to Branch 2. Adjourned  Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on June 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:11 AM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Brian Smestad, DF: Justin Mark Sommerfeld appeared from jail, pro se. Court reviews file, public defender is unable to be present this morning. Court sets INIT during intake today to allow DE to speak to public defender. Adjourned. kma  Initial appearance scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

for continuance of 6/23 INIT. filed by PD's Office. km
Per SJN, Granted. Reschedule within a week. kap/km
Filed by Atty Schmidt. km

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty Schmidt. km
Initial appearance on June 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:34 AM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Brian Thomas Smestad,  DF:  Justin Mark Sommerfeld appeared from jail, pro se. Court reviews file. Court reviews PFAC, DE states that he contacted the public defender's office and he qualifies. Court advises DE to contact public defender to let them know about the next hearing date. Court sets INIT. Adjourned: 10:37 AM. kma  Initial appearance scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Misdemeanor and Criminal Traffic Scheduling Order. Signed by SJN on 6/21/2022. c: DA and Atty via e-file. km

10:31 AM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA: Brian Smestad, DF: Justin Mark Sommerfeld appeared from jail, pro se. Court reviews file, notes DE wished to represent himself. DE states that he believes he has lost his job while in custody and believes he will qualify for publuc defender. Court advises DE to contact public defender's office to reapply. PFAC given to DE in case he does not qualify. ADA Smestad requests bond modification to include absolute sobriety condition. Court amends bond. Adjourned: 10:42 AM. kma
Bail/bond hearing on June 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

01:44 PM   CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: S. Fox, ADA:   Brian Thomas Smestad w/Intern A. Kasey, DF ATTY:  Abrianna Dolfi for today,  DF:  Justin Mark Sommerfeld appeared from jail. Def does not qualify for PD and wishes to represent himself. A plea is not taken today to preserve rights. Court sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Settlement conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
